definition: preparation/to prepare/to intend/to be about to/reserve (fund)
to prepare/get ready/to provide or equip

pinyin: cun2 kuan3 zhun3 bei4 jin1 lu:4

sentences.english: Pregame warming-up practice on shooting! It does help.
sentences.chinese: 賽前準備活動投籃練習，是很有幫助的。

sentences.english: We are busy preparing the land for sowing.
sentences.chinese: 我們忙於平整土地，準備播種。

sentences.english: So in the interest of helping out the next generation of thieves, I'm going to offer you a few pointers.
sentences.chinese: 所以，爲了有助於下一代遊蕩者們，我準備教你幾招。

sentences.english: A must for the amateur anthropologist who seeks to guage the feromonic field.
sentences.chinese: 爲業餘人類學家在測量領域尋求軌跡而準備的物品。

sentences.english: If you have handouts, do not read straight from them.
sentences.chinese: 如果你準備了講義，不要完全照着讀。

sentences.english: It's like having an array of stomp boxes ready for action.
sentences.chinese: 它有一個數組的單塊效果器隨時準備採取相應的行動。

sentences.english: Put the commemorative coin well prepared on air brushing mouth.
sentences.chinese: 將準備好的紀念幣放入上方噴繪口處。

sentences.english: Before dawn, the wife went downstairs to prepare the family feast.
sentences.chinese: 在黎明前，妻子下樓去準備家裏的酒席。

sentences.english: Fenders will be ready in 20 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 防碰墊將在20分鐘內準備好。

sentences.english: Florals are for middle-aged women with weight problems.
sentences.chinese: 大花圖案都是爲那些有體重問題的中年婦女所準備的。

sentences.english: With the back end in place and ready to store messages, you need an announcer.
sentences.chinese: 後端就位並準備好存儲消息後，您需要一個播音程序。

sentences.english: I have kept a reserve fund in case of accidents.
sentences.chinese: 我已籌備了一筆準備基金以防不測。

sentences.english: A frend is going to visit a girl you know well.
sentences.chinese: 一個朋友正準備去看望你很熟悉的一個女孩子。

sentences.english: And did you know that there are really zillions of ways to prepare a great seafood meal?
sentences.chinese: 你知道嗎，準備一頓美好的海鮮大餐有無數種方法？

sentences.english: "I came near forgetting," said he. "You are to have a brazier of charcoal ready."
sentences.chinese: “我忘了，”他說，“你得準備一爐煤火。”

sentences.english: Aunt is ready for you to eat the teeth do not hurt the sugar, to taste, welcome to.
sentences.chinese: 阿姨準備了適合你喫不傷牙齒的糖，歡迎到時來嚐嚐。

definition: plan/project/program/to plan/to map out/CL:個|个[ge4],項|项[xiang4]
outcome/result/conclusion/in the end/as a result/to kill/to dispatch
to decide (to do something)/to resolve/decision/CL:個|个[ge4],項|项[xiang4]/certainly
should/ought to/probably/must be/to deserve/to owe/to be sb's turn to do sth/that/the above-mentioned
only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
to continue/to proceed with/to go on with
